rows.translation: By the break of Day

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful.

rows.translation: By the Nights twice five;
By the even and odd (contrasted);
And by the Night when it passeth away;-

rows.arabic: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
rows.translation: Is there (not) in these an adjuration (or evidence) for those who understand?
rows.transliteration: hal fī dhālika qasamul lidhī ḥijr

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
rows.translation: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the 'Ad (people),-
rows.transliteration: alam tara kayfa fa`ala rabbuka bi`ād

rows.translation: Of the (city of) Iram, with lofty pillars,

rows.arabic: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
rows.translation: The like of which were not produced in (all) the land?
rows.transliteration: allatī lam yukhlaq mithluhā fil bilād

rows.translation: And with the Thamud (people), who cut out (huge) rocks in the valley?-
rows.transliteration: wathamūdal ladhīna jābuṣ ṣakhra bil wād

rows.translation: And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes?
(All) these transgressed beyond bounds in the lands,
And heaped therein mischief (on mischief).
Therefore did thy Lord pour on them a scourge of diverse chastisements:
For thy Lord is (as a Guardian) on a watch-tower.

rows.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكْرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَكْرَمَنِ
rows.translation: Now, as for man, when his Lord trieth him, giving him honour and gifts, then saith he, (puffed up), "My Lord hath honoured me."
rows.transliteration: fa-ammal-insānu idhā mab-talāhu rabbuhu fa-akramahu wana``amahu fayaqūlu rabbī akraman

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَـٰنَنِ
rows.translation: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"
rows.transliteration: wa-ammā idhā mab-talāhu faqadara `alayhi rizqahu fayaqūlu rabbī ahānan

rows.translation: Nay, nay! but ye honour not the orphans!
Nor do ye encourage one another to feed the poor!-
And ye devour inheritance - all with greed,
And ye love wealth with inordinate love!

rows.arabic: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
rows.translation: Nay! When the earth is pounded to powder,
And thy Lord cometh, and His angels, rank upon rank,
rows.transliteration: wajā-a rabbuka wal malaku ṣaffan ṣaffā

rows.arabic: وَجِا۟ىٓءَ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
rows.translation: And Hell, that Day, is brought (face to face),- on that Day will man remember, but how will that remembrance profit him?
rows.transliteration: wajī-a yawma-idhin bijahannam ۚ yawma-idhiy yatadhakkarul-insānu wa-annā lahudh dhikrā

rows.translation: He will say: "Ah! Would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this) my (Future) Life!"
For, that Day, His Chastisement will be such as none (else) can inflict,
And His bonds will be such as none (other) can bind.
(To the righteous soul will be said:) "O (thou) soul, in (complete) rest and satisfaction!
"Come back thou to thy Lord,- well pleased (thyself), and well-pleasing unto Him!
"Enter thou, then, among My devotees!
"Yea, enter thou My Heaven!
